title: Ninety Six National Historic Site: News
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News             News       The National Park Service makes every effort to keep visitors informed about news events, special events, park programs and services and new or ongoing projects. News releases for Ninety Six National Historic Site will be posted and archived here, so check back to keep current about the happenings at the park. Ninety Six National Historic Site will also keep our visitors informed about what is happening in the park on our Facebook page.  Â      Logo of NPCA Courtesty National Parks Conservation Association  In the Spring of 2010, Ninety Six National Historic Site conducted a Visitor Study with the help of the Park Studies Unit at the University of Idaho. You can take a look at the questionnaire, the final report (.pdf, 2.14 MB, 112 pages), and the executive summary. For more information, please visit the Park Studies Unit at the University of Idaho.   The National Parks Conservation Association published an assessment on Ninety Six called State of the Parks: Ninety Six National Historic Site, A Resource Assessment in June 2010. Take a look at the full report (.pdf, 4.97 MB, 28 pages) and the summary. More information can be found on the National Parks Conservation Association website.
